content.description: The following list shows three factors that can either increase or decrease the probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error.
content.question: The sample size is increased. The significance level is increased. The standard error is increased. Which factors alone will cause the probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></math> error to increase?

choices.label: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
